examples: his temper sparked like damp firewood

results.definition: make more temperate, acceptable, or suitable by adding something else
the elasticity and hardness of a metal object; its ability to absorb considerable energy before cracking
harden by reheating and cooling in oil
a disposition to exhibit uncontrolled anger
examples: his temper was well known to all his employees

results.definition: a characteristic (habitual or relatively temporary) state of feeling

results.definition: bring to a desired consistency, texture, or hardness by a process of gradually heating and cooling
